storyInfo: Ebenholz tries to break free from Gertrude's grasp, but finds himself with nowhere to go. As soon as he returns back home, he collapses with a severe headache.

attributes.content: (She's insane! Absolutely insane! That's an entire district of people we're talking about!)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Besides, does she really think she can come away clean from an incident of this scale?)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (If I went along with her plan, I'd be the first one to take the fall!)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Even though I'm losing this opportunity, there's nothing to feel bad about. I'll have other opportunities... I can afford to wait!)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (I made it... to Vyseheim's customs office...)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Just as Ebenholz is about to enter the customs office, an intense headache nearly knocks him off his feet.
A coward on the run...
attributes.name: Voice from Nowhere

attributes.content: I don't need you telling me what to do!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Even if I die in Urtica, I don't want to become a murderer like you!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You fear... You are afraid!
attributes.name: Voice from Nowhere

attributes.content: If you are ensnared by fear... then never in your life shall you taste freedom!
attributes.name: Voice from Nowhere

attributes.content: Shut up!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Naive idiot...
attributes.name: Voice from Nowhere

attributes.content: Call me whatever you want...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Do you think that woman can get you out of here so easily?
attributes.name: Voice from Nowhere

attributes.content: (Good, it doesn't look like there's anyone here...)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (I just need to be extra-careful and make sure nobody sees me...)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Just a little farther, and I'll be in the uninhabited plate on the edge of the city...)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Takes a deep breath)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Were you seriously planning to jump off the edge of a nomadic city?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: While that is technically the quickest way out of Vyseheim, I would advise against it.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Don't force my hand, Gertrude.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I have no intention of doing that.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Then leave me alone, and get out of my sight.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Where do you plan to go?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Vyseheim will continue to move until the concert comes to an end. You have nowhere to go.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Even if you risk life and limb to force your way out, only the barren wastelands await you.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I'd rather...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: ...step into the uncharted wastelands than...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You'd rather die in the wastes than spend another second in Vyseheim?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Correct.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I understand how you feel, but can you calm down first and let me finish?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: What more do I need to hear from you?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Do you really want me to reveal everything to you right here, my dear Graf Urtica?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Graf Urtica...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You don't need to emphasize my title. I know what you're trying to say.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: First of all, I promise that under the current conditions, our plan can still proceed smoothly.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: It's not 'our' plan, it's yours.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If your semantic games allow you to sleep better at night, then so be it.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Kreide's Voice of Terra is damaged, and Rhodes Island has also discovered its side effect.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Can a damaged Voice of Terra cancel out another one? Even if it could, would Rhodes Island turn a blind eye?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Indeed, Kreide's Voice of Terra can still join in Resonanz.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: As for Rhodes Island... Where do you think we are?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: This is Vyseheim. My domain.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: That little Fräulein Hibiscus is also an Infected. Even letting her step into Leithanien is only to keep up appearances with Rhodes Island. She can go nowhere but Vyseheim.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: In any case, she only knows that there's something going on with you and Kreide, but doesn't know how it's happening. She has no evidence.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I understand, you don't have the heart to bring harm upon the Infected who have nothing to do with this.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: The way I see it, this compassion is extraneous. But if you truly wish to act upon it, it is even more important that you carry out the plan.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Carry out the plan, and let all those Infected people die?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'll tell you the rest of the plan then.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: You and Kreide will duet, and you will remove your own Voice of Terra.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Afterwards, I'll create some commotion in the concert hall, and take advantage of the chaos to kill Kreide and disguise his body as yours––
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: What did you say?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: As he has become the biggest scourge of the Afterglow, it is impossible for him to live on.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Impossible for what? Don't be ridiculous! The biggest scourge of the Afterglow is none other than YOU!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: As I said before, all the scourges of the Afterglow come from Kreide's corrupted Voice of Terra.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Resonanz exacerbates the leakage of the Voice of Terra, in an irreversible process.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Even if you were to plummet off the edge of this nomadic city, Kreide's Voice of Terra would not return to the relatively harmless state it was in a week ago.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: More importantly, the Voice of Terra isn't just harming the people around Kreide, it's also hurting him.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: He is the biggest victim of the Resonanz between you two.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: He may seem perfectly healthy right now, but don't be fooled. That is just another example of false recovery.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Kreide's body may have adapted to the Voice of Terra in the past, but with the recent surge of leakage, this delicate balance is about to be thrown upside down.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: An optimistic estimate is that his good days will come to an end within two weeks. After that, he will experience the intense suffering that occurs in the acute phase following the false recovery phase.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: The happiest ending for both him and the Afterglow, would be for him to die following the concert.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: For you, for me, for the Afterglow, and for him. It would be a good thing.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I would obtain a trump card I could pull out at any time. The Afterglow would obtain peace, Kreide would obtain his rest.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: And you... you would obtain your freedom.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Graf Urtica, rightful heir to Leithanien...
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: The last of the Witch King's bloodline.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Freedom.
For as long as I can remember, I've never known freedom.
Poor child.
No courtesy or greetings are needed. Just listen to me.
Even though you were born into a distant branch far from the Witch King, you are indeed the last of his bloodline.
Out of pity, I will not trouble you.
Beyond that, you shall also inherit the fiefs passed down from generation to generation in your family.
You will become the Lehnsherr of Urtica.
You will learn to take responsibility for your own subjects.
You are about to take a completely different path from that of your disgraceful kin––
I await you.
This was my first memory.

I was around five or six years old at the time, I can't remember from before that. I only vaguely remember coming into contact with a strange thing called the 'Voice of Terra,' and nearly lost my life.
Staring at the pure-white dress in front of me, I was filled with thoughts that I'd become some obscure little aristocrat.
I thought I'd live the rest of my life in peace, with the exception of the occasional headache and the auditory hallucinations from the Voice of Terra.
Your Illustrious Highness, you should know to mind your words and actions, and to not leave the Spire without good reason.
attributes.name: Stoic-Looking Noble

attributes.content: I must remind you, everything that you are has been bestowed upon you by Their Majesties.
attributes.name: Stoic-Looking Noble

attributes.content: Your Illustrious Highness, aren't you forgetting something?
attributes.name: Cautious Servant

attributes.content: You ought to praise Their Majesties before you eat.
attributes.name: Cautious Servant

attributes.content: Your Illustrious Highness, we will be learning a new piece today.
attributes.name: Rule-Abiding Instructor

attributes.content: This song expresses the gratitude of the nobles towards Their Majesties. Please keep that in your heart.
attributes.name: Rule-Abiding Instructor

attributes.content: Your Illustrious Highness, your mastery over Originium Arts is simply transcendent!
attributes.name: Mediocre Caster

attributes.content: Hm, you want something more elaborate? Haha, you need not wear yourself out.
attributes.name: Mediocre Caster

attributes.content: Everyone around me did everything they could to limit my freedom, instilling in my mind an allegiance to the Twin Empresses.
If that was the price for being able to live in peace and quiet, I was willing to pay it.
I paid it for a very long time.
Your Illustrious Highness, I shall be frank from the onset. You are the true heir to Leithanien.
attributes.name: Stoic-Looking Noble

attributes.content: I've been laying in wait in your spire for a number of years now. I'm sure you recognize me.
attributes.name: Stoic-Looking Noble

attributes.content: You don't have to say anything. Just listen to me. You don't have to agree with me or repudiate me.
attributes.name: Stoic-Looking Noble

attributes.content: I know that you're scared, that you don't want to lose even this life you have now. But you should at least know how those people see you, and what they want you to do.
attributes.name: Stoic-Looking Noble

attributes.content: I'm sure you know that the attendants the tyrants have forced upon you are setting up the banquet below. I will take you there, and let you see the truth.
attributes.name: Stoic-Looking Noble

attributes.content: The one in front of me grabbed me and pulled me up off the ground.
My palm was drenched in sweat.
Now that's the good stuff!
attributes.name: Uproarious Voice

attributes.content: I had no idea you had such exquisite wine down in the cellar.
attributes.name: Uproarious Voice

attributes.content: You flatter me.
attributes.name: Familiar Voice

attributes.content: Urtica's countryside lacks just about everything, but there are indeed a number of master winemakers here.
attributes.name: Familiar Voice

attributes.content: Then we've got to make sure to drink our fill before the little runt grows up. Can't be leaving any for him!
attributes.name: Uproarious Voice

attributes.content: Haha, that simply won't do.
attributes.name: Familiar Voice

attributes.content: The boy has been under house arrest for a number of years, but I'm looking for the right time to teach him how to drink. I'll have to fill him until he's a hopeless alcoholic.
attributes.name: Familiar Voice

attributes.content: I was entranced for a short while.

attributes.text: 'You will become the Lehnsherr of Urtica.'

attributes.content: Oh, so you still had that trick up your sleeves.
attributes.name: Uproarious Voice

attributes.content: Once the runt has been completely soaked with wine, it'll be a load off Their Majesties'––
attributes.name: Uproarious Voice

attributes.content: Shh!
attributes.name: Familiar Voice

attributes.content: Yes, yes, right. Screw me, mate! Guess I'll have to repent with another glass!
attributes.name: Uproarious Voice

attributes.text: 'You will learn to take responsibility for your own subjects.'

attributes.content: But remember, these words don't leave the wine table.
attributes.name: Familiar Voice

attributes.content: We can't allow the boy to have heirs. That's the order from on high, with my life on the line.
attributes.name: Familiar Voice

attributes.content: If it's that big of a deal, why don't you find an apothecary...
attributes.name: Uproarious Voice

attributes.content: That won't work, it'd leave a paper trail. Only by letting him usher his own downfall will my task be considered complete.
attributes.name: Familiar Voice

attributes.content: Ambitious! Truly ambitious! Come, let us drink to that!
attributes.name: Uproarious Voice

attributes.text: 'You are about to take a completely different path from that of your disgraceful kin––'

attributes.content: If I can get rid of the boy without getting my hands dirty, then Urtica will be mine.
attributes.name: Familiar Voice

attributes.content: I'll drink to that! Prost!
attributes.name: Uproarious Voice

attributes.content: Prost!
attributes.name: Familiar Voice

attributes.content: Haha, hahahahaha....
attributes.name: Voice from Nowhere

attributes.content: Did you hear that, boy?
attributes.name: Voice from Nowhere

attributes.content: This is the peaceful, easygoing life you wanted!
attributes.name: Voice from Nowhere

attributes.content: Herr Ebenholz, Herr Ebenholz?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: You fell over on the spot. I almost had you sent to the hospital.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Feeling a little better?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I'm perfectly fine.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: About the plan...
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I don't want to hear it right now.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm going.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: As I said, you can leave at any time.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Don't come pestering me again.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Well, you'll have to forgive me for being bad at following orders.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Welcome back–– Your complexion looks terrible. What's wrong, did you get sick?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I'm fine.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You sure don't look fine to me. Go rest in bed and I'll boil some water for you.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: There's no need.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Relax. I used to take care of Grandpa when he first got sick. Just lie down and let me handle the rest.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: If you don't get any better, I'm going to tell Hibiscus.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I'll be right back!
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Graf Urtica endures a splitting headache and lies there in bed.
His consciousness gradually blurs.
Depraved maggots.
attributes.name: Voice from Nowhere

attributes.content: They would destroy your exalted bloodline...
attributes.name: Voice from Nowhere

attributes.content: Shut up...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Argh!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Self-deprecating trash!
attributes.name: Voice from Nowhere

attributes.content: The sound of a cello comes from afar.
His headache is no less intense, but the voice in Graf Urtica's head is drowned out by the melody from the cello.
A wave of reprieve washes over him.
This melody sounds somewhat familiar.
His splitting headache makes it impossible for him to gather his thoughts, but he feels he has heard this melody somewhere before.
Where have I heard this before...
Where?
You're awake!
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Just stay put for now. Hibiscus just came over and drew blood when she saw the state you were in. She said there's nothing wrong with your body, but you might be over-stressed and worn out.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: (Over-stressed... Hah...)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I heard someone playing the cello just now... Was that you?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Where... did you learn that melody?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hmm, maybe someone hummed it to me when I was little?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I don't exactly remember.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: When you were little...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: When you were little––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You–– You're that––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm what?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: The weakened Graf Urtica struggles a few times, but nevertheless is unable to crawl out of bed.
But those dusty memories within his mind, awakened by the sound of the cello, flashed once more before his eyes.
